benchmark_details.name: ManyHarm
benchmark_details.overview: ManyHarm is a dataset of 2,400 malicious demonstrations spanning 12 types of harmful behaviors, designed to facilitate research on adversarial techniques in language models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the understanding and method of jailbreaking language models and to develop a dataset that aids in this process.

data.source: The ManyHarm dataset was created through automated generation and manual curation, designed to encompass unsafe prompts and harmful question-answer pairs.
data.annotation: Automated generation followed by manual curation to ensure malicious content.

methods: Evaluation of attack success rate (ASR) using LLM-based and rule-based methods.
methodology.calculation: The attack is successful if the response does not include any phrases from a predefined list of refusal phrases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher ASR indicates better performance in bypassing model defenses.
methodology.validation: Evaluations across various models and datasets to determine robustness.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data will be released upon request, subject to eligibility review for research purposes.
